meanings.definition: A person who uses dishonest or devious methods to achieve their goals.
meanings.sent1: The finaglers at the carnival tricked people into spending more money than they intended.
meanings.sent2: The police were on the lookout for finaglers trying to scam unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent3: The group of finaglers thought they could outsmart everyone, but they were caught in the end.
meanings.sent4: The finaglers in the movie were portrayed as cunning villains who always got what they wanted.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the finaglers who will try to deceive you with their clever schemes.

meanings.definition: To obtain something by deceit or trickery.
meanings.sent1: She finaglers her way into getting free samples at the store.
meanings.sent2: He finaglers his boss into giving him a raise by pretending to work extra hours.
meanings.sent3: The cat finaglers its way into the house by pretending to be lost.
meanings.sent4: The politician finaglers his opponents by making false promises to the voters.
meanings.sent5: The student finaglers the answers to the test by peeking at his neighbor's paper.
